title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 103.7 - Signs and markers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 103.7 - Signs and markers

State Regulations
(a) Highway signs. The following signs are
approved for use on highways with respect to ATV operation: (1)
ATV route marker. Image
(i) The sign shall have a white legend and
border upon a green background which will be reflectorized. It shall be 24 x 18
inches with a 1/2-inch border. It shall be used along highways or parts of
highways where the use of ATV's is permitted by official designation in
conformance with section
2405
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. (ii)

The ATV route marker shall be used in
combinations and assemblies similar to other route markers as provided in the

Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices (17 NYCRR
251.17
-
251.23
) to indicate
the direction of permitted use. The directional arrow marker shall be mounted
immediately below the ATV route marker and shall have a white legend on a green
background. (iii)

It shall be
located at intervals as necessary to clearly mark the permitted path of travel
and at turns in the path. The height, lateral placement and orientation shall
conform to the Uniform Manual of Traffic Control Devices (17 NYCRR
201.5
). (2)
ATV crossing
sign. Image
(i) The sign shall have a black legend on a
yellow background which shall be reflectorized. The height, lateral placement
and orientation shall conform to the Uniform Manual of Traffic Control Devices
(17 NYCRR
201.5
). (ii)

This sign is
intended to warn traffic of a reasonably well defined ATV trail crossing where
conditions such as sight distance and number of ATV's crossing warrant such
use. This sign shall not be used in advance of a public intersection where an
intersection sign may be warranted, nor where other warning signs indicate the
existence of the crossing. (iii)

The standard sign shall be 30 x 30 inches with a 1/2-inch margin and a 3/8-inch
border. A larger sign, 36 x 36 inches with a 5/8-inch margin and a 7/8-inch
border, may be used where greater emphasis of visibility is required. A smaller
sign, 24 x 24 inches with a 3/8-inch margin and a 5/8-inch border, may be used
on highways having no more than one moving lane of traffic in each direction, where approach speeds are low and where physical conditions make the use of a
standard size impractical as a ground-mounted sign. (iv)

This sign is in posting category I set
forth in 17 NYCRR
230.2. Advance posting distances should be measured from the
near side of the crossing. (b) Off-highway. Any sign used off-highway
with respect to ATV operation shall be the appropriate sign as specified in
this section and the Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices (17 NYCRR Parts
200
-
302
) which would be used with respect to such operation on a public
highway. Notes
